page.title: 02PERCEPTIONS OF THE CHURCH
page.content: Mr. Davis, a Cornishman, was very aware of the differences of his work as a Vicar in Nottingham compared to { {Lostwithiel.}He found that the Cornish hated change. The pace in Cornwall, he found much slower. Mr. Davis started a {Fellowship}Group, which had no more than five members; now there are forty. People are being drawn to the church by this and along with this increase in numbers has been the variation in ages, young and old alike. By holding the traditional { {Prayer Book}service and the new modern service, he has been able to cater for everyone. The Vicar believes more and more are turning to the church, a lot of them young people. He finds it difficult to exercise his ministry to youth because of diocesan restrictions and he may move.
